pullRequest.body:
Go through all porting notes that contain the string "proof was" and try to fix them. The following steps were used:
 * Golf the new proof.
 * If the current proof is nicer, delete the note.
 * Try to restore the old proof.
 * Classify some of the old failing proofs.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [4276c9e91f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17836/commits/4276c9e91f3fc1d309402dc64ee9de8610c0d3a9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ instance [âˆ€ x : B, TopologicalSpace (E x)] : âˆ€ x : B', TopologicalSpace ((f *áµ– E) x)`
`- instance [âˆ€ x : B, TopologicalSpace (E x)] : âˆ€ x : B', TopologicalSpace ((f *áµ– E) x) := by`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
bors d+

:v: Vierkantor can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a380157b-7ae8-48f5-8c1f-120b6b63aba1) for commit c4d95ad3c2ae84817dc036d56f693e7e138e765e.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/d925131b-281d-4022-b77c-75d80b5b6c9b/to/a380157b-7ae8-48f5-8c1f-120b6b63aba1) against commit 8e7833a57c7331fcf2a2b9776482ae29dca6d004.
Looks like the benchmark is happy, so @grunweg: happy to merge?

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11392094851/job/31697360801)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11392094851/job/31697361084)

Thanks!
maintainer merge

Thanks!
maintainer merge
Small nit: I think English orthography ask to start in lower-case after a colon. (This is pre-existing, though.)
I'm not sure what the old proof was, but this one seems fine.
The Mathlib 3 proof was `Î» _, hs.symm â–¸ S.star_mem'`, which needs slight tweaks in Lean 4 because the triangle doesn't seem to rewrite the `ha` argument. So imo the `simpa` is fine here.
Same here. Let's benchmark the change to `where`, though.
According to `count_heartbeats` at least, either option is exactly as fast.
Personal nit: feel free to use \mapsto here.
This is indeed at least as nice as the original proof.
Would you like to keep the porting notes here? I can see them being useful to nerd-snipe somebody into investigating, but I also think the current proof seems fine.
Since the only difference is the extra `simp only`, I suppose this is not enough of a regression to keep around the old comment. I'll remove them.
Same for this one, and the proof below.
Feel free to use \mapsto here: optional.
Pointing this out to maintainers: I'd appreciate a look if there's any downside to this particular proof by `rfl`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: fix "proof was" porting notes
